perturbation.original_text: Affiliate(s) are the entities listed on Exhibit E to this Agreement that are either business units of Distributor (and therefore wholly-owned and a part of Distributor) or are wholly-owned subsidiaries of Distributor, but in either case, only for so long as ownership remains as defined in this provision.
perturbation.changed_text: Affiliate(s) are the entities listed on Exhibit E to this Agreement that are business units of Distributor or subsidiaries of Distributor, including entities with partial ownership by Distributor. For the purposes of this Agreement, an Affiliate shall be defined as any entity listed on Exhibit E, regardless of ownership percentage.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction in the definition of 'Affiliate'. The original text states that Affiliates are wholly-owned subsidiaries, while the modified version includes entities with partial ownership, creating ambiguity about which entities qualify as Affiliates under the agreement and creating uncertainty in enforcement.

perturbation.original_text:
2.4 Hardware Support.
2.4.1 Return for Replacement. During the Cisco warranty period, DISTRIBUTOR may return failed Product to Cisco for replacement. Cisco will use commercially reasonable efforts to ship a replacement within [*****] days after receipt of the failed Product from DISTRIBUTOR. After the end of the warranty period, parts will be charged at Cisco's then-current rates.
2.4.2 DISTRIBUTOR may request advance replacement delivery of replacement parts (Cisco will send the part upon DISTRIBUTOR's receipt of an RMA number) at Cisco's then-current Advance Replacement charge.
2.4.3 Product used for replacement may be new or equivalent to new, at Cisco's discretion.
perturbation.changed_text:
2.4 Hardware Support.
2.4.1 Return for Replacement. During the Cisco warranty period, DISTRIBUTOR may return failed Product to Cisco for replacement. Cisco will use commercially reasonable efforts to ship a replacement within [*****] days after receipt of the failed Product from DISTRIBUTOR. After the end of the warranty period, parts will be charged at Cisco's then-current rates.
2.4.2 DISTRIBUTOR may request advance replacement delivery of replacement parts (Cisco will send the part upon DISTRIBUTOR's receipt of an RMA number) at no charge to Distributor.
2.4.3 Product used for replacement will always be new.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the cost of advance replacement parts and the condition of replacement products. The original text states that advance replacements are subject to Cisco's 'then-current Advance Replacement charge', but the modified text says there is no charge. The original also allows for 'new or equivalent to new' products, whereas the modified version dictates that they 'will always be new'. These conflicting terms creates uncertainty around financial obligations and the expected quality of replacements.
perturbation.location: EXHIBIT B VALUE ADDED DISTRIBUTOR SUPPORT EXHIBIT

perturbation.original_text:
17.1 With regard to both Distributor and Affiliates' activity, Distributor shall keep full, true, and accurate records and accounts, in accordance with generally-accepted accounting principles, of each Product or Service purchased and deployed, Resold, or distributed by serial number, including information regarding compliance with Cisco marketing and sales programs, Software usage, and export or transfer. Distributor shall make these records available for audit by Cisco upon [*****] prior written notice, during regular business hours, at Distributor's principal place of business or such other of Distributor's locations where Distributor may maintain relevant records. [*****].
All reporting and related obligations in this Section 17 apply to not only data regarding Distributor's activities, but also the activities of the Affiliates. All such information shall be compiled into one report unless otherwise directed herein. The report(s) shall identify the specific Distributor entity involved in the subject transaction.
perturbation.changed_text:
17.1 With regard to both Distributor and Affiliates' activity, Distributor shall keep full, true, and accurate records and accounts, in accordance with generally-accepted accounting principles, of each Product or Service purchased and deployed, Resold, or distributed by serial number, including information regarding compliance with Cisco marketing and sales programs, Software usage, and export or transfer. Distributor shall make these records available for audit by Cisco upon [*****] prior written notice, during regular business hours, at Distributor's principal place of business or such other of Distributor's locations where Distributor may maintain relevant records. [*****].
All reporting and related obligations in this Section 17 apply only to data regarding Distributor's activities. Affiliates are responsible for maintaining and submitting their own reports separately. The report(s) shall identify the specific Distributor entity involved in the subject transaction.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding who is responsible for reporting. The original text states that the Distributor is responsible for reporting on both its own activities and those of its Affiliates, while the modified text states that Affiliates are responsible for submitting their own reports separately. This creates uncertainty regarding which entity is ultimately accountable for providing complete and accurate reporting to Cisco.
